actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-61, by Mr. Derrick.

Rule provides for consideration of. Waiving the requirement for a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House with respect to resolutions reported on the legislative day of April 22, 1993, to provide for the consideration or disposition of the bill H.R. 1335, making emergency supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1993, any amendment thereto, any conference report thereon, or any amendment reported in disagreement from a conference thereon.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 29.

official_title: Waiving a requirement of clause 4(b) of rule XI with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules.

summary.text: Waives provisions of rule XI of the Rules of the House of Representatives that require a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House with respect to resolutions reported by such Committee on April 22, 1993, to provide for the consideration or disposition of H.R. 1335 (emergency supplemental appropriation for FY 1993), including any amendment, conference report, or any amendment reported from conference in disagreement thereon.

titles.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 4(b) of rule XI with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules.
